column4: I've got a samba server setupon Ubuntu.  It's wide open.  How do I mount it up?  I keep getting a no such device or address error
mount it up from where ?
a linux client.  Here's what I'm trying (in fedora) mount -t cifs //192.168.0.10/shares /home/craig/CANDO-remote/
and it says what, exactly ? is your current user a samba user on the server ? is browsing open for all ?
yes, it's wide open.  No user or pass required.  "retrying with upper case share name  mount error 6 = No such device or address  Refer to the mount.cifs(8) manual page (e.g.man mount.cifs)
no such device usually refers to your local mount point
nope, it's there
I get the same error when I try to mount it in /mnt
anything in the server's logs ? if not, then it *is* an address issue - you're not even getting out of the client
[2007/01/14 16:23:12, 0]  smbd/service.c:make_connection(851)  192.168.0.2 (192.168.0.2) couldn't find service shares
so you have no share called "shares"
I do.  It's /shares on the ubuntu box
yet, the client disagrees...
what does "smbstatus" on the server say ?
I know.  They really don't know each other that well...
nothing is connected
but you do have a singel share called "shares" ?
Yes
and connecting on the server with smbclient works ?
haven't tried that.  Let me man that command; never used it
Ahhh, a smbclient -L showed that although the folder is called shares, the share is called share1.  All set now.
